groupbuilder.utility.number_to_text.number_to_column

groupbuilder.utility.number_to_text.number_to_column(n)[source]

Convert a given positive integer to its corresponding Excel-style column name.

This function implements the algorithm to convert numerical column indices to alphabetical Excel-style column labels (e.g., A, B, …, Z, AA, AB, etc.).

The conversion follows these rules: - Column 1 maps to ‘A’ - Column 26 maps to ‘Z’ - Column 27 maps to ‘AA’ - Column 52 maps to ‘AZ’ - Column 53 maps to ‘BA’ - And so on…

Parameters:

n (int) – The column number to convert. Must be 1 or greater.

Returns:

The corresponding column name in Excel-style (e.g., 1 -> ‘A’, 27 -> ‘AA’).

Return type:

str

Raises:

ValueError – If the input number is less than 1.
